featureResponse.summary: Four teens circulate a special pair of jeans during their first summer apart in this adaptation of Ann Brashares's popular novel. In a thrift store, the four best friends find a single pair of jeans that magically flatters each girl's figure. By sharing the jeans through the mail, the girls stay in touch during a summer that changes all of their lives.

featureResponse.title: Sleeping With the Enemy
featureResponse.shortSummary: Abused housewife Julia Roberts goes to extremes to escape her homicidal ex-husband in this gripping thriller.
featureResponse.summary: Julia Roberts is a pretty woman with an ugly marriage in this love-and-death thriller. Abused in body and spirit by her husband, she succumbs to his desires until a boating accident lets her stage her own death. A happier life under a false identity beckons--and so does romance with a gentle new man. But her husband is on her trail--with the ultimate revenge in mind!

featureResponse.title: Snow Day
featureResponse.shortSummary: Kids in upstate New York have a wild day of fun, pranks and misadventures thanks to a sudden, school-canceling blizzard.
featureResponse.summary: Kids in upstate New York have a wild day of fun, pranks and misadventures thanks to a sudden, school-canceling blizzard in this "laugh-out-loud" (Chicago Tribune) family film.

featureResponse.title: Something New
featureResponse.shortSummary: A smart, successful black woman struggles with her feelings for a charming, blue-collar white guy in this funny, touching film.
featureResponse.summary: Kenya (Sanaa Lathan) is an attractive L.A. accountant who doesn't want to be among the 42.4% of black women who never marry. But her search for the 'Ideal Black Male' is turned upside-down when she meets a handsome white landscape designer (Simon Baker). They both feel the sparks...but can they take their feelings to the next level?

featureResponse.title: Something the Lord Made
featureResponse.shortSummary: Fact-based story of a white surgeon and a black lab technician who revolutionized heart surgery amidst the racial injustice of the 1940s.
featureResponse.summary: Two men--one a wealthy white chief surgeon, the other a poor black lab technician--achieve a monumental medical breakthrough that earned one accolades...and the other a painful lesson in racism and unequal opportunity in 1940s Baltimore. Alan Rickman and Mos Def star in this 'HBO Films' drama.

featureResponse.title: Sometimes in April
featureResponse.shortSummary: Two brothers are divided by marriage and fate during the 100 horrifying days of the 1994 Rwandan genocide.
featureResponse.summary: In a nation decimated by ethnic rage, two brothers are divided by marriage and fate. This gripping drama based on true events focuses on the 100 horrifying days of the 1994 Rwandan genocide, when over 800,000 Tutsi people were killed by Hutu nationalists. Against this terrifying backdrop is the story of two Hutu brothers--one in the military, the other a radio personality.

featureResponse.title: Son of the Mask
featureResponse.shortSummary: A mask that transforms its wearer into a marvel of mischief wreaks havoc on an aspiring cartoonist in this zany sequel to 'The Mask.'
featureResponse.summary: A mask that transforms its wearer into a marvel of mischief wreaks havoc on the life of a young aspiring cartoonist in this zany sequel to 'The Mask.' Tim Avery is the animator who turns himself into a real-life cartoon with help from a mask that belongs to the god of mischief, Loki. Tim's got big problems when his toddler son and goofball dog don the mask and go wild!

featureResponse.title: Son of the Pink Panther
featureResponse.shortSummary: Chief Inspector Dreyfus gets some unwelcome assistance from a klutzy gendarme who turns out to be the illegitimate son of his late nemesis.
featureResponse.summary: When an Arabian princess is kidnapped in Nice, Chief Inspector Dreyfus gets some unwelcome assistance from a klutzy local gendarme who turns out to be none other than the illegitimate son of his late nemesis--Jacques Clouseau!

featureResponse.title: South Park: Bigger, Longer & Uncut
featureResponse.shortSummary: The foul-mouthed, pint-sized kids of South Park, Colorado sneak into an R-rated movie that warps their fragile little minds.
featureResponse.summary: The rude and crude animated TV series comes to the big screen in this gleefully twisted musical comedy. After the foul-mouthed, pint-sized kids of South Park, Colorado sneak into an R-rated movie, it warps their fragile little minds. So their parents decide to declare war on the country that produced the movie--Canada!

featureResponse.title: The Special Relationship
featureResponse.shortSummary: The unique friendship shared by British prime minister Tony Blair and U.S. president Bill Clinton in the 1990s.
featureResponse.summary: They were two of the most powerful leaders of the free world who forged a loyal, if tempestuous, friendship out of the crucible of political necessity. Michael Sheen and Dennis Quaid star in the HBO Films drama that chronicles the 'special relationship' shared by British prime minister Tony Blair and U.S. president Bill Clinton in the 1990s.

featureResponse.title: Star Kid
featureResponse.shortSummary: Spencer is the loneliest seventh-grader on earth, until an intergalactic adventure--and a magical cybersuit--totally turn his world around.
featureResponse.summary: Spencer is the loneliest seventh-grader on earth, until an intergalactic adventure--and a magical cybersuit--totally turn his world around.

featureResponse.title: Staying Alive
featureResponse.shortSummary: John Travolta's back as disco king Tony Manero in this spirited sequel to his mega-hit 'Saturday Night Fever.'
featureResponse.summary: John Travolta's back as disco king Tony Manero in this spirited sequel to his mega-hit 'Saturday Night Fever.' Tony has left Brooklyn behind to seek a career as a Broadway dancer--and is caught between the pretty dancer who loves him and the haughty star he just can't get off his mind.

featureResponse.title: Step Up All In
featureResponse.shortSummary: Champions from previous films reunite for an all-star competition in Las Vegas to win a casino dance contract.
featureResponse.summary: Featuring "stunning dance numbers" (Variety), this installment in the popular franchise reunites champions from previous films for an all-star competition in Las Vegas to win a casino dance contract.

featureResponse.title: Stuart Little
featureResponse.shortSummary: A mouse named Stuart goes on the adventure of a lifetime after he is adopted by a human family in this live-action/animated hit.
featureResponse.summary: From E.B. White's book comes this fun mix of live-action and animation. The Littles (Geena Davis, Hugh Laurie) plan to adopt a baby boy, but it's love at first sight when they meet a mouse named Stuart (voice of Michael J. Fox)! The family's mean-spirited cat (voice of Nathan Lane) doesn't feel so loving though, leading Stuart to be kidnapped and taken a long way from home!

featureResponse.title: Stuart: A Life Backwards
featureResponse.shortSummary: A poignant, tragic true story that traces in reverse the events that shaped a homeless man's life.
featureResponse.summary: Meet Stuart Shorter. He's a homeless, delusional, psychotic, substance-abusing ex-convict. And his life story is utterly irresistible. Adapted by Alexander Masters from his award-winning biography, this HBO Films production is a poignant, tragic true story that unfolds in reverse the life of a young boy who was transformed into a violent convict and substance abuser.

featureResponse.title: The Suburbans
featureResponse.shortSummary: A spontaneous performance at a wedding prompts the reunion of a one-hit wonder '80s New Wave band in this comedy.
featureResponse.summary: A one-hit wonder '80s New Wave band stages a spontaneous performance at the wedding of one of the group's members. Soon, sexy record exec Jennifer Love Hewitt has the washed-up group of fortysomethings ready to retake the world with their songs!

featureResponse.title: Summer Rental
featureResponse.shortSummary: A relaxing beach vacation is anything but for hapless John Candy and his family in this riotous summer comedy.
featureResponse.summary: A relaxing beach vacation is anything but for John Candy and his family in this sunny summer comedy. Their cottage is a dump, Dad manages to get an awful sunburn...and then he breaks his leg. And things go from bad to worse when he offends local millionaire Richard Crenna, who tries to get them evicted!

featureResponse.title: Summer School
featureResponse.shortSummary: Heartthrob Mark Harmon is a teacher flunking love with co-worker Kirstie Alley in this breezy comedy.
featureResponse.summary: Heartthrob Mark Harmon is a teacher flunking love with co-worker Kirstie Alley in this breezy comedy directed by Carl Reiner. If the hunk doesn't turn his rowdy kids into students, he has no chance at romance!

featureResponse.title: The Sunset Limited
featureResponse.shortSummary: A black ex-con and a suicidal white professor share a philosophical debate within the confines of a New York tenement apartment.
featureResponse.summary: From Cormac McCarthy comes this searing drama that explores the debate between belief and atheism...afterlife and nihilism...salvation and suicide. Starring Tommy Lee Jones and Samuel L. Jackson and set in a New York apartment, the film focuses on a high-stakes philosophical debate between a black ex-con who claims to hear the voice of Jesus and a suicidal white professor.

featureResponse.title: Sunshine
featureResponse.shortSummary: A space mission is mankind's last hope to prevent the sun from burning out in this sci-fi thriller set in the not-so-distant future.
featureResponse.summary: A space mission is mankind's last hope to prevent the sun from burning out in this sci-fi thriller. With Earth facing a never-ending winter, the crew journeys towards the dying star in the hope of resurrecting it to full power with a massive atomic bomb. But as they near their target, a mysterious signal is received that sets a frightening series of events into motion.

featureResponse.title: Superstar
featureResponse.shortSummary: Molly Shannon re-creates her popular "Saturday Night Live" character of super-nerdy Irish-Catholic schoolgirl Mary Katherine Gallagher.
featureResponse.summary: Super-nerdy Irish-Catholic schoolgirl Mary Katherine Gallagher has two simple dreams in life: being famous and sharing a long, soulful, Hollywood-style kiss with the hunkiest boy in class. Molly Shannon re-creates her popular "Saturday Night Live" character in this comedy romp co-starring Will Ferrell.

featureResponse.title: Super Capers
featureResponse.shortSummary: A would-be superhero (with no known powers) leads a group of equally dysfunctional super beings on a mission to stop an evil plot.
featureResponse.summary: A would-be superhero (with no known powers) leads a group of equally dysfunctional super beings on a journey through time to stop a criminal mastermind's evil plot in this comic book satire.

featureResponse.title: Taking Chance
featureResponse.shortSummary: A military officer's life is changed after taking an assignment to escort home the body of a 19-year-old Marine killed in Iraq.
featureResponse.summary: In 2004, Lt. Col. Michael Strobl volunteered to escort home the body of a 19-year-old Marine killed in Iraq. It would prove to be a life-altering experience. Kevin Bacon stars as Strobl in this profoundly moving 'HBO Films' drama that looks at the military rituals for honoring its war dead from the perspective of one fallen soldier named Chance Phelps.

featureResponse.title: The Talented Mr. Ripley
featureResponse.shortSummary: A penniless young man becomes intoxicated by the lush life in Italy and will do anything to hold on to it.
featureResponse.summary: Matt Damon stars in this "mesmerizing" (CBS-TV) psychological thriller from Oscar(R)-winning director Anthony Minghella ("The English Patient"). Damon plays a penniless young man hired to retrieve a millionaire's playboy son from Italy, but becomes intoxicated by the lush life and will do anything to hold on to it.

featureResponse.title: Talkin' Dirty After Dark
featureResponse.shortSummary: This comedy showcases the laughs and overlapping love lives of a handful of raunchy stand-up comics at a late-night L.A. comedy club.
featureResponse.summary: This comedy showcases the laughs and overlapping love lives of a handful of raunchy stand-up comics at a late-night L.A. comedy club. Dukie's is an L.A. hotspot featuring a lineup of both novice and notorious comedians who get big laughs with dirty jokes. With Martin Lawrence.

featureResponse.title: Tammy
featureResponse.shortSummary: After getting fired and catching her husband with another woman, a woman hits the road with her randy, hard-drinking grandmother.
featureResponse.summary: Melissa McCarthy co-wrote and stars in this offbeat blend of comedy and drama, about a frustrated, working-class Midwesterner who, after losing her job and catching her husband with another woman, decides to hit the road with her randy, hard-drinking grandmother.

featureResponse.title: Tanta Agua (So Much Water)
featureResponse.shortSummary: A 14-year-old girl is forced to go on vacation with her divorced dad only to get stuck indoors during a weeklong rainstorm.
featureResponse.summary: A 14-year-old girl is forced to go on vacation with her divorced dad only to get stuck indoors during a weeklong rainstorm. But things brighten up when she meets a cute boy her age and plots to woo him.

featureResponse.title: Temple Grandin
featureResponse.shortSummary: An autistic woman becomes an unlikely hero to America's cattle industry--and to autistic people everywhere--in this fact-based story.
featureResponse.summary: Claire Danes shines in this fact-based story of an autistic woman who became an unlikely hero to America's cattle industry--and to autistic people everywhere. This HBO Films production is an engaging portrait of a stigmatized, misunderstood young woman who learned to channel her unique gifts into a brilliant career as a scientist, author and groundbreaking animal advocate.

featureResponse.shortTitle: Tengo Ganas de Ti (I Want You)
featureResponse.title: Tengo Ganas de Ti (I Want You)
featureResponse.shortSummary: Returning to Madrid in the wake of a friend's death, a young man finds romance--only to have his first love return.
featureResponse.summary: Returning to Madrid in the wake of a friend's death, a young man finds romance--only to have his first love return. Mario Casas, Clara Lago and Maria Valverde star in this sequel to 'Three Meters Above the Sky.'

featureResponse.title: Thank You for Smoking
featureResponse.shortSummary: Aaron Eckhart lights up the laughs with a devilishly dry performance as a smooth-talking smoking lobbyist in this acclaimed satire.
featureResponse.summary: Aaron Eckhart lights up the laughs with a devilishly dry performance as a smooth-talking smoking lobbyist in this acclaimed satire. Nominated for a 2006 Golden Globe (Best Actor--Musical or Comedy), Eckhart sparkles as Nick Naylor, the silver-tongued spokesman for the Academy of Tobacco Studies, who fearlessly promotes cigarettes in the face of anti-smoking naysayers.

featureResponse.title: That Awkward Moment
featureResponse.shortSummary: Three commitment-phobic bros vow to stay single and avoid serious relationships at all costs., but can they stick to their pact ?
featureResponse.summary: Three commitment-phobic bros vow to stay single and avoid serious relationships at all costs, but can they stick to their pact in the face of so much sexy temptation?

featureResponse.title: Thelma & Louise
featureResponse.shortSummary: Susan Sarandon and Geena Davis are two best friends on the run from the law in a 1966 T-Bird in this award-winning hit.
featureResponse.summary: Susan Sarandon and Geena Davis are two best friends on the run from the law in a 1966 T-Bird in this award-winning hit.

featureResponse.title: Throw Momma From the Train
featureResponse.shortSummary: The paths of professor Billy Crystal and dimbulb student Danny DeVito crisscross in murder in this spoof of 'Strangers on a Train.'
featureResponse.summary: Billy Crystal is a frustrated writing professor. Danny DeVito is his dimwitted student. When their paths crisscross, the result is a first-rate spoof of Alfred Hitchcock's 'Strangers on a Train' as DeVito tries to get Crystal to trade murders of the dominating females in their respective lives--DeVito's beastly mother and Crystal's nasty ex-wife.

featureResponse.title: Tigerland
featureResponse.shortSummary: Joel Schumacher's taut drama about a group of fearful young troops at their final training point before being shipped to Vietnam.
featureResponse.summary: Joel Schumacher's taut drama about a group of fearful young troops at their final training point before being shipped to Vietnam. At the film's core is a terrific performance by newcomer Colin Farrell as Roland Bozz, a frustrated youth whose rebelliousness serves to strengthen the bond among his mates.

featureResponse.title: Timecode
featureResponse.shortSummary: Tales of Hollywood come to life in this film that is divided into four quadrants in which different stories take place at once.
featureResponse.summary: An all-star cast brings to life tales of Hollywood in this film that is divided into four quadrants in which different stories take place at once. The stories focus on a movie producer, his wife, his mistress and her lover...and the business itself, with satirical nudges at both mainstream and arthouse filmmaking.

featureResponse.title: Todos Tenemos un Plan (Everybody Has a Plan)
featureResponse.shortSummary: An Argentinean doctor assumes the identity of his deceased twin--unaware of his brother's ties to the criminal underworld.
featureResponse.summary: An Argentinean doctor who wants to escape his mundane life gets more than he bargained for when he assumes the identity of his deceased twin--unaware of his brother's ties to the criminal underworld. Viggo Mortensen has a dual role in this well-acted psychological thriller.

featureResponse.title: Too Big to Fail
featureResponse.shortSummary: A gripping look at the financial crisis of 2008 from the perspective of the insiders who prevented a global economic meltdown.
featureResponse.summary: In the mid-2000s, Wall Street was booming: record high bonuses, multimillion-dollar salaries, a skyrocketing housing market. But in 2008, it all came crashing down. This gripping drama chronicles that unprecedented financial crisis and the inner sanctum of men and women who played key roles in preventing a global meltdown unlike anything seen before.

featureResponse.title: Trail of the Pink Panther
featureResponse.shortSummary: The Pink Panther diamond is missing again...and so is Inspector Clouseau in this sidesplitting comedy!
featureResponse.summary: The Pink Panther diamond is missing again...and so is Inspector Clouseau! Classic footage from previous capers combines with entire sequences never seen before of Peter Sellers as Clouseau.

featureResponse.title: The Truman Show
featureResponse.shortSummary: An insurance agent doesn't know is that his life is actually a popular 24-hours-a-day TV show and his family and friends are all actors.
featureResponse.summary: Jim Carrey plays an insurance agent who doesn't know is that his life is actually a hugely popular, 24-hours-a-day TV show shot on a gigantic studio set, and that his family and friends are all actors!

featureResponse.title: The Trumpet of the Swan
featureResponse.shortSummary: A young trumpeter swan who can't make a sound goes on an odyssey to find his voice in this animated fable.
featureResponse.summary: In this animated fable, a young trumpeter swan named Louie suffers from low self-worth when he is unable to make a sound. To help him, his father steals a trumpet for him. But this makes Louie feel guilty, and starts him on an odyssey from a human school to the jazz clubs of the East Coast--all to find his voice, repay his father's debt and impress a beautiful swan.

featureResponse.title: Tsunami, The Aftermath Part 1
featureResponse.shortSummary: Part 1 of 2. HBO Films' miniseries event that focuses on the aftermath of the tsunami that devastated the coast of Thailand in late 2004.
featureResponse.summary: Part 1 of 2. HBO Films in association with BBC presents this two-part miniseries event that focuses on the aftermath of the tsunami that devastated the coast of Thailand on December 26, 2004. This gripping tale of loss, survival and hope follows a group of fictional characters whose lives are irrevocably transformed by the cataclysmic destruction.

featureResponse.title: Tsunami, The Aftermath Part 2
featureResponse.shortSummary: Part 2 of 2. HBO Films' miniseries event that focuses on the aftermath of the tsunami that devastated the coast of Thailand in late 2004.
featureResponse.summary: Part 2 of 2. HBO Films in association with BBC presents this two-part miniseries event that focuses on the aftermath of the tsunami that devastated the coast of Thailand on December 26, 2004. This gripping tale of loss, survival and hope follows a group of fictional characters whose lives are irrevocably transformed by the cataclysmic destruction.

featureResponse.title: The Tuskegee Airmen
featureResponse.shortSummary: High-flying drama about the 'fighting 99th'--the first squadron of African American U.S. Army Air Corps combat fighter pilots in WWII.
featureResponse.summary: The 'fighting 99th' was the first squadron of African-American U.S. Army Air Corps combat fighter pilots in WWII. When they began training, few, if any, in the Army wanted them there. They had to prove that they were stronger, tougher, smarter and better fliers than most white pilots...and they did! Laurence Fishburne stars in this high-flying drama.

featureResponse.title: The Two Jakes
featureResponse.shortSummary: Director/star Jack Nicholson is at his best as salty detective Jake Gittes in this sizzling sequel to 'Chinatown.'
featureResponse.summary: Detective Jake Gittes (Jack Nicholson) becomes a witness while investigating an adultery/murder case...which might make him an accomplice. The recording he secretly makes leads not only to the real killer, but to a fortune in oil--and the truth about a woman from his early days in Chinatown. Director/star Nicholson is at his best in this sizzling sequel to 'Chinatown.'

featureResponse.title: Tyson
featureResponse.shortSummary: The life of Mike Tyson who rocketed to the top of the boxing world before he was sidetracked by personal demons and bad advice.
featureResponse.summary: His talent took him from a poverty-stricken childhood on the mean streets of Brooklyn to fame--and unimaginable fortune--as the youngest heavyweight champion in boxing history. Mike Tyson was on top of the world until bad advice--and his own personal demons--turned his American dream into an American nightmare. Newcomer Michael Jai White plays Mike Tyson in this riveting film.

featureResponse.title: The Untouchables
featureResponse.shortSummary: Fearless Feds take on Prohibition-era Chicago's most powerful crime czar, Al Capone, in Brian De Palma's gangster epic.
featureResponse.summary: Fearless Feds take on Prohibition-era Chicago's most powerful crime czar, Al Capone, in Brian De Palma's gangster epic. Kevin Costner plays G-man Eliot Ness, whose team of agents was nicknamed 'The Untouchables' for their incorruptibility. Robert De Niro is fantastic as Capone and Sean Connery won the 1987 Best Supporting Actor Oscar(R) for his performance.

featureResponse.title: Up in the Air
featureResponse.shortSummary: George Clooney is a well-traveled firing expert who lives for his life on the road in this 2009 Best Picture Oscar(R)-nominee.
featureResponse.summary: Nominated for six 2009 Oscars(R), including Best Picture, this acclaimed drama stars George Clooney as a well-traveled firing expert who lives for his life on the road. For Ryan Bingham (Clooney), home is the flight he's on to his next assignment. But when this 'termination facilitator' faces a technological threat to his constant travels, can he settle for love?

featureResponse.title: A Very Brady Sequel
featureResponse.shortSummary: The Brady Bunch maintain their sunny '70s disposition in the face of bigamy, knavery, kidnapping and more in this comedy sequel.
featureResponse.summary: America's favorite prime-time pack is back in all its ditzy glory. The one and only Brady bunch now find themselves smackdab in the middle of the stormy '90s--but they never lose that sunny '70s outlook. Not even in the face of bigamy, knavery, kidnapping and Zsa Zsa Gabor! A 'highly entertaining' (Variety) comedy based on the classic TV show.

featureResponse.title: Vital Signs
featureResponse.shortSummary: Romance spells complications for competing med students in a big-city hospital. Adrian Pasdar, Diane Lane and William Devane star.
featureResponse.summary: Romance spells complications for competing med students in a big-city hospital. A 'strikingly well-done' (Variety) drama about the lives and loves of five young doctors-to-be. The great cast includes Adrian Pasdar, Diane Lane, William Devane, Norma Aleandro and Jimmy Smits.

featureResponse.title: Volunteers
featureResponse.shortSummary: Cheerfully self-centered rich kid Tom Hanks heads to back-country Thailand to escape his huge gambling debts in this comedy.
featureResponse.summary: The time is the 1960s. Peace Corps volunteers spread American goodwill--and the secrets of sanitation--all over the world. But one cheerfully self-centered rich kid (Tom Hanks) has come to back-country Thailand for another reason: to escape his huge gambling debts. 'Newsweek' magazine called this 1985 comedy 'One of the year's funniest.'

featureResponse.title: Wag the Dog
featureResponse.shortSummary: A spin doctor and a Hollywood producer stage a phony war to distract the public from a sex scandal involving the U.S. president.
featureResponse.summary: Political satire about a spin doctor and a Hollywood producer who stage a phony war and whip up a jingoistic media blitz to distract the public from a sex scandal involving the U.S. president. Dustin Hoffman, Robert De Niro.

featureResponse.title: Walking With Dinosaurs
featureResponse.shortSummary: A little pachyrhinosaurus becomes an unlikely hero to his herd in this epic prehistoric adventure.
featureResponse.summary: Prepare to enter the incredible prehistoric world of the dinosaurs in this epic adventure! With a herd of mighty pachyrhinosaurus' on the move and facing a variety of threats--including the terrifying T-Rex--it's up to one unlikely member of the group named Patchi to overcome his devious brother and lead them to safety. A 'gorgeous visual feast' (Canada.com).

featureResponse.title: Walkout
featureResponse.shortSummary: The stirring true story of Chicano students who staged a walkout to protest injustices in the high-school system in 1968 Los Angeles.
featureResponse.summary: This HBO Films production details the stirring true story of a group of Mexican American students who staged a compelling 1968 walkout to protest the injustices of the public high-school system in East L.A. Alexa Vega stars as an idealistic honors student whose desire to fight the system's blatant discrimination leads her to coordinate a multi-school walkout of students.

featureResponse.title: Walk of Shame
featureResponse.shortSummary: L.A. news reporter Elizabeth Banks desperately tries to make it to a big audition after getting stranded during a wild night out.
featureResponse.summary: Jilted and (she thinks) jobless, L.A. news reporter Meghan (Elizabeth Banks) throws caution to the wind and agrees to a night of partying that ends in a one-night stand with handsome James Marsden. Learning that she actually has a shot at a major network job, Meghan must navigate the city streets on foot--and in a tiny yellow mini-dress--to make it to her audition on time.

featureResponse.title: WarGames
featureResponse.shortSummary: Matthew Broderick plays a teenage computer hacker who taps his bedroom terminal into the government's top secret missile-defense system.
featureResponse.summary: Matthew Broderick plays a teenage computer hacker who sets off a chain reaction that threatens global catastrophe when he taps his bedroom terminal into the governments top secret missile defense system.This fast-paced thriller co-stars Dabney Coleman as a harried scientist and Ally Sheedy as the heros adventurous girl friend.

featureResponse.title: The Warriors
featureResponse.shortSummary: A band of youths suspected in the death of a gang leader must face a legion of city gangs bent on revenge in this 1979 cult classic.
featureResponse.summary: 'Warriors, come out to plaaa-aayyyy!' In this 1979 cult classic, a band of youths suspected in the death of a bigtime gang leader must face a legion of city gangs bent on revenge. Michael Beck stars in this visually slick adventure of urban warfare directed by Walter Hill. 'Exhilarating...one movie that moves' (New York).

featureResponse.title: The Waterboy
featureResponse.shortSummary: Adam Sandler takes his Ragin' Cajun from waterboy to star linebacker for a small college team in this comedy.
featureResponse.summary: Adam Sandler brings his Ragin' Cajun to the football field in this off-the-wall comedy. Mistreated and maligned as a Louisiana university football team's waterboy, Bobby Boucher puts his rage on the stage playing linebacker for a lousy, low-level college team and leading them all the way to a Bowl game vs. his former team!

featureResponse.title: The Way Way Back
featureResponse.shortSummary: An introverted teen's dreaded summer vacation is transformed when he lands a job with the screwball crew of a local water park.
featureResponse.summary: For introverted teen Duncan, summer vacation is looking like a worst-case scenario: his stepfather is a jerk, his stepsister hates him and he has no friends. When he meets a screwball water-park employee, he not only lands a job, but he forms an unlikely friendship that will change him forever. 'An endearingly sweet coming of ager' (Variety).

featureResponse.title: West Side Story
featureResponse.shortSummary: Natalie Wood and Richard Beymer star in this classic musical retelling of 'Romeo and Juliet' set among New York's warring gangs.
featureResponse.summary: With a score by Leonard Bernstein and choreography by Jerome Robbins, this is one of the all-time great screen musicals and 'nothing short of a cinema masterpiece' ('N.Y. Times')! Natalie Wood and Richard Beymer are the young lovers in a retelling of the Romeo and Juliet tale set among New York's warring gangs. Ten 1961 Academy Awards(R), including Best Picture.

featureResponse.title: Wet Hot American Summer
featureResponse.shortSummary: Break out the cutoff shorts and bad haircuts for this hilarious time-warp comedy about the last day at a Maine summer camp in 1981.
featureResponse.summary: Break out the cutoff shorts and bad haircuts for this hilarious time-warp comedy about the last day at a Maine summer camp in 1981. Janeane Garofalo heads up an all-star cast of counselors and campers as they get crazy one final time before the summer's gone.

featureResponse.title: We're the Millers
featureResponse.shortSummary: Jennifer Aniston and Jason Sudeikis are unlikely drug smugglers on the RV ride from hell to retrieve a pot shipment from Mexico.
featureResponse.summary: A small-time pot dealer is forced to become a big-time drug smuggler in this outrageous comedy. Jennifer Aniston and Jason Sudeikis head up a hilarious cast in this hit film that finds Sudeikis recruiting a 'family' (stripper-neighbor Aniston and a pair of misfit teens) to serve as his cover as they cross the Mexican border in an RV to retrieve a massive weed shipment.

featureResponse.title: What Planet Are You From?
featureResponse.shortSummary: Riotous sex farce about an alien who comes to Earth in order to impregnate a woman and facilitate a takeover.
featureResponse.summary: Erectile dysfunction takes on extraterrestrial proportions in this sex farce about an alien whose private parts sound like a blender when he's aroused! Arriving on Earth, Harold Anderson must impregnate a human female so his kind can take over the planet. But Harold's efforts fail miserably...until he meets fortyish loser Susan and the 'blender' kicks into high gear!

featureResponse.title: What to Watch: April 2015
featureResponse.shortSummary: Check out some of the exciting programming coming to HBO in April 2015...and beyond.
featureResponse.summary: Check out some of the exciting programming coming to HBO in April 2015...and beyond.

featureResponse.title: The Whole Ten Yards
featureResponse.shortSummary: Hit man Bruce Willis and frazzled dentist Matthew Perry reteam for more laughs and more gunplay in this sequel to 'The Whole Nine Yards.'
featureResponse.summary: Bruce Willis and Matthew Perry re-team for more laughs and gunplay in this sequel. Picking up where 'The Whole Nine Yards' left off, hit man Jimmy (Willis) has traded in his six-shooter for an apron while wife Jill handles the killing. Meanwhile, nerve-wracked dentist Oz (Perry) is busy dealing with his pregnant wife and a vengeful mob boss who has just been paroled.

featureResponse.title: Wicker Park
featureResponse.shortSummary: A man enters a dangerous world of seduction and deception as he tracks down his long-lost love, who disappeared two years earlier.
featureResponse.summary: In this twist-filled mystery, a Chicago advertising executive (Josh Hartnett) on the verge of getting married thinks he spots his long-lost love who disappeared two years earlier. Putting his plans on hold, he becomes obsessed with tracking her down, entering a dangerous world of seduction and deception

featureResponse.title: Winter's Tale
featureResponse.shortSummary: True love--and true evil--transcend time in this epic love story based on Mark Helprin's 1983 novel.
featureResponse.summary: In early 20th-century New York City, thief Peter Lake (Colin Farrell) falls for a dying girl (Jessica Brown Findlay)--a romance that his sadistic boss Pearly wants to sabotage. But in a world of angels, demons and time travel, Peter awakens in 2014 where a woman (Jennifer Connelly) helps him piece together his past...even as the malevolent Pearly continues to stalk him.

featureResponse.title: The Witches
featureResponse.shortSummary: An innocent boy is pitted against the wickedest witch east of Kansas in this darkly entertaining fairy tale.
featureResponse.summary: An innocent boy is pitted against the wickedest witch east of Kansas! Anjelica Huston is 'creepy and campy...a femme fatale of the broomstick set' ('New York Post') in her role as a witch who plans to turn all of Britain's children into mice. Jim Henson's special effects add a touch of magic to this wickedly entertaining fairy tale based on the book by Roald Dahl.

featureResponse.title: Without Limits
featureResponse.shortSummary: A biographical look at the life of impetuous Olympic runner Steve Prefontaine.
featureResponse.summary: Robert Towne ('Tequila Sunrise') helmed this biographical look at the life of Olympic runner Steve Prefontaine (Billy Crudup). The story follows the talented but impetuous track star from his days under legendary coach Bill Bowerman (Donald Sutherland) and his run in the 1972 Munich Olympic games to his tragic early death in a car wreck.

featureResponse.title: The Wolverine
featureResponse.shortSummary: A battle-weary Wolverine faces a deadly threat in Japan--minus his self-healing powers--in this thrilling installment in the series.
featureResponse.summary: A battle-weary Wolverine faces a deadly threat--and his own demons--in Japan in this thrilling installment in the 'Wolverine' series. Hugh Jackman returns as the haunted mutant X-man who is summoned to Japan where he winds up in battle once again--but minus the self-healing powers that have always spared him in the past.

featureResponse.title: Woo
featureResponse.shortSummary: A sassy party girl goes on a blind date with a nerdy law clerk after a psychic tells her she's about to meet her true love.
featureResponse.summary: Jada Pinkett Smith is Woo, a sassy party girl looking for Mr. Right who agrees to go on a blind date with a nerdy law clerk (Tommy Davidson) after a psychic tells her she's about to meet her true love. What ensues is a wild and wacky night of comical misadventures as the irrepressible Woo takes her shy date on a madcap tour of Big Apple night spots.

featureResponse.title: Working Girl
featureResponse.shortSummary: Melanie Griffith is a pretty secretary who trades in her miniskirt for a business suit to prove that she's more than just a pair of legs.
featureResponse.summary: Can a Staten Island secretary trade in her miniskirt for a business suit and convince the corporate sharks she's more than a pair of legs? Melanie Griffith plays Tess McGill, a Wall Street Cinderella who uses her double-dealing boss Sigourney Weaver's skiing mishap to pass herself off as a major player in a business deal. And the perks include handsome Harrison Ford!

featureResponse.title: The World's End
featureResponse.shortSummary: Five friends reunite for an epic bar crawl that takes an otherworldly turn in this horror-comedy from the makers of 'Shaun of the Dead.'
featureResponse.summary: Twenty years after failing to complete the 'Golden Mile' (a pint of beer in each of 13 pubs), five old friends reunite for another go at completing the bar crawl in this horror-comedy from the makers of 'Shaun of the Dead.' When they discover the locals are not what they seem, they have only one hope: get to the World's End, the 13th and final stop on their epic circuit.

featureResponse.title: X-Men: Days of Future Past
featureResponse.shortSummary: Characters from the original X-Men movies join forces with their younger selves to go back in time to prevent their annihilation by robots.
featureResponse.summary: The X-Men unite in this "spectacular" (Chicago Tribune) "adrenaline-fueled" (NY Daily News) blockbuster. As gigantic Sentinel robots annihilate mutants, characters from the original X-Men movies join forces with their younger selves to go back in time and alter history before it's too late.

featureResponse.title: X-Men: The Last Stand
featureResponse.shortSummary: The discovery of an antibody that can turn mutants into normal humans results in full-scale war in this third entry in the 'X-Men' saga.
featureResponse.summary: An antibody that can turn mutants into normal humans results in full-scale war in this third 'X-Men' film. At the core of the controversy is a boy whose body produces the antibody. While Charles Xavier and his X-Men are leery of this new 'cure,' the wrathful Magneto and his mutants--led by the resurrected Jean Grey a.k.a. Dark Phoenix--set out to annihilate every trace of it.

featureResponse.title: Yesterday
featureResponse.shortSummary: Oscar(R)-nominated Best Foreign Language Film about an African woman with AIDS who vows to live to see her daughter go to school.
featureResponse.summary: In a place where life is full of adversity, one woman shows how courage, compassion and love can change the course of tomorrow. This 2004 Oscar(R) nominee for Best Foreign Language Film puts a human face on the politics and statistics of the AIDS crisis in Africa through the story of a woman dying of the disease who vows to live to see her daughter go to school.

featureResponse.title: You Don't Know Jack
featureResponse.shortSummary: Al Pacino stars as Dr. Jack Kevorkian, the infamous "Doctor Death" who became the poster child for assisted suicide in the 1990s.
featureResponse.summary: Angel of mercy...or Doctor Death? In the 1990s, Dr. Jack Kevorkian became one of the most polarizing figures in modern American history. Al Pacino brings Dr. Death to life in 'You Don't Know Jack,' a Barry Levinson film that follows him through his first assisted suicide, the media frenzy that followed and the decade-long war of wills between Kevorkian and state prosecutors.

featureResponse.title: 2 Guns
featureResponse.shortSummary: Denzel Washington and Mark Wahlberg are undercover operatives on the run for their lives holding millions in drug money.
featureResponse.summary: Denzel Washington and Mark Wahlberg 'make for a very enjoyable pair of double-crossed undercover operatives' (Variety) in this action-thriller. Initially unaware of each other's real identity, the pair pulls off a heist of a drug cartel that leaves them holding over $40 million--and running from a wide variety of thugs who want to relieve them of the loot and their lives.

featureResponse.title: 300: Rise of an Empire
featureResponse.shortSummary: The war for Greece spills over to the high seas in this stunning, visceral sequel to '300.' Sullivan Stapleton and Eva Green star.
featureResponse.summary: From Frank Miller's graphic novel comes this stunning sequel to '300' that takes the bloody battle for Greece to the high seas. It's up to fearless Greek general Themistokles (Sullivan Stapleton of 'Strike Back') to unite his nation against a monstrous adversary: the massive Persian Navy led by sinister Xerxes and his vixen commander Artemisia (a scene-stealing Eva Green).

featureResponse.title: 8 Mile
featureResponse.shortSummary: Eminem stars in this semi-autobiographical story about an aspiring rapper who dreams of escaping his life of crushing poverty in Detroit.
featureResponse.summary: Music superstar Eminem is "magnetic" (Variety) in this semi-autobiographical story about an aspiring rapper who dreams of escaping his life of crushing poverty in Detroit. But to do that, he first has to conquer his personal demons and compete in a series of grueling hip-hop battles with rival rappers. Oscar(R)-winner for Best Original Song.

featureResponse.title: 10 Things I Hate About You
featureResponse.shortSummary: An overprotective father forbids his youngest daughter to date until her older sister finds a beau.
featureResponse.summary: In this "sharp and snappy" (L.A. Times) teen riff on Shakespeare's "The Taming of the Shrew," an overprotective father forbids his youngest daughter to date until her older sister finds a beau. So little sis plots to find a boyfriend for her man-hating sibling.

featureResponse.title: 12 Years a Slave
featureResponse.shortSummary: The 2013 Oscar(R)-winning Best Picture about a free black man in 1841 who was kidnapped and sold into slavery.
featureResponse.summary: Winner of the Oscar(R) for 2013 Best Picture, this fact-based drama provides an unflinching depiction of American slavery like no other film before. Based on the memoir by Solomon Northup, the film details the story of the free black man from the North who was kidnapped and sold into slavery in 1841, spending 12 years suffering at the hands of cruel Southern plantation owners.

featureResponse.title: 28 Days
featureResponse.shortSummary: Sandra Bullock plays a NYC writer whose drinking escapades land her in a 28-day rehabilitation clinic.
featureResponse.summary: For New York writer Gwen Cummings (Sandra Bullock), life has landed on the rocks...with a splash or ten of booze. After ruining her sister's wedding, she is sent on a 28-day stint at a rehab center. The singing, chanting and group hugs have Gwen climbing the walls, but as she slowly bonds with fellow addicts, her eyes are opened to the problems that consume her.

featureResponse.shortSummary: Jackie Robinson's rise to break Major League Baseball's color barrier is the focus of this inspiring bio-pic.
featureResponse.summary: Jackie Robinson's rise to become the first African American player in baseball are chronicled in this bio-pic. Chadwick Boseman stars as Robinson who stood tall in the face of rampant racism while becoming a superstar for the Brooklyn Dodgers. Harrison Ford co-stars as Dodgers G.M. Branch Rickey who made the historic decision to break baseball's color barrier.

featureResponse.title: 47 Ronin
featureResponse.shortSummary: 47 samurai plot revenge against the evil warlord responsible for the death of their master in this retelling of the popular Japanese tale.
featureResponse.summary: 47 samurai plot to take revenge against the evil warlord responsible for the death of their master in this lavish, action-packed retelling of the popular Japanese tale. Keanu Reeves stars as an enslaved half-breed who is enlisted by the warriors to help carry out their plan of vengeance.
